meanings.definition: The act of demolishing a building or structure.
meanings.sent1: The teardowns of old houses in the neighborhood have been causing a lot of noise.
meanings.sent2: The city council approved the teardowns of several abandoned buildings to make space for a new park.
meanings.sent3: During the teardowns of the old factory, the workers found a hidden room filled with antique furniture.
meanings.sent4: The teardowns of the ancient walls revealed intricate carvings that had been hidden for centuries.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise of the teardowns echoed through the empty streets, signaling the start of a new era.

meanings.definition: A property that is purchased with the intention of being demolished and rebuilt.
meanings.sent1: The real estate developer bought several teardowns in the downtown area for future construction projects.
meanings.sent2: The rundown house on the corner was a popular choice for teardowns among investors.
meanings.sent3: The rundown teardowns in the neighborhood were like blank canvases waiting for a new masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: The old teardowns stood as a reminder of the changing landscape of the city.
meanings.sent5: The teardowns along the riverfront were prime locations for upcoming development plans.

meanings.definition: The process of disassembling a device or machine for repair or maintenance.
meanings.sent1: The technician carefully conducted the teardowns of the faulty equipment to identify the issue.
meanings.sent2: Regular teardowns of the machinery helped prevent unexpected breakdowns in the factory.
meanings.sent3: The playful robot decided to do some teardowns on its own to see how it worked.
meanings.sent4: The teardowns of the old clock revealed a complex mechanism of gears and springs.
meanings.sent5: The detailed teardowns of the computer components required precision and patience to reassemble correctly.
